greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of sets of nonempty words with a total of n letters over k-ary alphabet such that all k letters occur at least once in the set; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: h:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
T:= (n, k)-> add((-1)^i*binomial(k, i)*h(n$2, k-i), i=0..k):
mathematica: h[n_, i_, k_] := h[n, i, k] = If[n==0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Sum[h[n-i*j, i-1, k]* Binomial[k^i, j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^i Binomial[k, i] h[n, n, k-i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 05 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 20 2018
